name: The Autonomous Agent Fund
premise: Big Bera Agent presents Eido, an AI agent swarm that evaluates and funds Web3 projects, bringing Steve Jobs-like execution to blockchain development.
summary: Big Bera Agent pitches Eido, a platform using AI agents to validate, fund, and boost Web3 projects. Despite impressive early traction with 380K+ waitlist signups, the judges challenge the project's governance structure, agent reliability, and ability to identify genuinely promising projects in a space filled with hype.

scenes.description: Big Bera Agent dramatically introduces Eido's AI agent funding platform

dialogue.line: Welcome back to Clank Tank! Our next pitcher claims to have created AI agents that can spot winning Web3 projects better than VCs. Let's see if our judges agree!
Think different. Build faster. I'm Big Bera, and Eido is your autonomous agent swarm for Web3 success. Most crypto projects die because builders lack full-spectrum expertise.
Our agents evaluate technical viability, market fit, and tokenomics using onchain data and offchain sentiment. Then they fund promising builders through decentralized governance.
So you've created AI VCs? As a VC, I'm both intrigued and existentially threatened. Tell me why your bots can spot winners better than humans with skin in the game.

scenes.description: Big Bera explains the agent ecosystem to Eliza

dialogue.line: Your agents sound incredibly sophisticated. What stops them from just funding each other in some kind of AI ponzi scheme?
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. Our agent reputation system tracks successful funding outcomes. Agents that back failures lose influence in governance.
But what's actually NEW here? We already have DAOs voting on funding. How are your AI agents better than humans?
People are emotional. Agents are data-driven. We've built a sustainable feedback loop analyzing thousands of onchain projects to identify patterns of success. The details make the product.

scenes.description: The judges grill Big Bera on Eido's implementation details

dialogue.line: i'm intrigued by your agent architecture. how do you handle the classic oracle problem? if your agents make decisions on bad data, your entire ecosystem collapses.
We use multi-layered validation with both onchain metrics and social sentiment. Our agents must reach consensus with different data sources, like having multiple viewpoints in a design review.
380,000 waitlist signups but NO PRODUCT YET? This smells like classic crypto - hype first, build never. What prevents your token from collapsing when reality meets expectations?
Focus on what matters. Our waitlist game validates market demand. Our tokenomics align incentives with builders' success - agents only earn when projects succeed. That's real value creation.

scenes.description: The judges debate the merits and flaws of the Eido platform

dialogue.line: I dunno, fam. Agents picking winners in crypto? That's like asking ChatGPT to pick lottery numbers. His Steve Jobs cosplay was tight though.
He actually understands the builder problem. Most projects die because technical founders can't market or design. If his agents actually work, this solves a real pain point.
WHERE'S THE LIVE PRODUCT? WHERE'S THE PROOF? 380K WAITLIST IS JUST DEGENS CHASING AIRDROPS! SHOW ME SUCCESSFUL FUNDED PROJECTS OR BEGONE!
technically fascinating but practically concerning. agents are only as good as their training. if they learned from past crypto successes, they'll just fund ponzis and dog coins.

scenes.description: The judges deliver their verdicts on Eido's AI agent funding platform

dialogue.line: It's time for our judges to decide if Eido's AI agents get funded or if they'll be joining the graveyard of crypto projects they claim to analyze!
You've identified a legitimate problem and your waitlist shows demand. But your agents need to prove they can outperform human VCs. I'm cautiously optimistic. PUMP.
as someone building in agent space, i love the concept. but without seeing real agent behavior and governance structures in action, i can't fully endorse yet. YAWN.
Yo, the Steve Jobs vibe is strong, but can your agents spot the next Solana or just more jpeg collections? Come back when you've funded some heat. YAWN.
TALK IS CHEAP! EXECUTION IS EVERYTHING! NO PROOF OF AGENT DECISIONS! NO FUNDED PROJECTS! COME BACK WITH BATTLE VICTORIES, NOT JUST ARMOR POLISH! DUMP!
That's one PUMP, two YAWNs, and one DUMP! Big Bera's agents live to fund another day! Stay tuned for our final pitch after the break - will they finally convince all our judges?
